title: How to Make Candy Cane Antlers

steps.headline: Wind a white and a red pipe cleaner together in a neat line.
steps.description: Keep the crossing points even all the way up, for the neatest look.

steps.headline: Bend the length over to form a hook.
steps.description: It should now take on the appearance of a candy cane.

parts.name: Adding the Candy Cane Antlers to a Headband

steps.headline: Kink the base of one candy cane to bend it slightly.
steps.description: Bend as little as possible, to avoid wasting the length.

steps.headline: Choose a spot for each candy cane to sit on the headband.
steps.description: They are meant to look like antlers, so space them apart enough. Mark with a pencil to remember the exact positioning.

steps.headline: Glue the bent portion of the first candy cane to the underside of the headband.
steps.description: Hold in place briefly to ensure it is tethered, then let dry completely.

steps.headline: Repeat with the other candy cane.
Pull the candy cane antlers upright.
steps.description: They should sit straight above the headband.

steps.headline: Slip the headband on.
steps.description: Once the antlers have completely dried in place, test the look in front of the mirror. Make any adjustments needed to the hook shape, to ensure it looks good.

steps.headline: Match the headband with a red or green sweater.
steps.description: Head out and have some holiday season fun.

text: Making the Candy Canes Wind a white and a red pipe cleaner together in a neat line. Keep the crossing points even all the way up, for the neatest look. Bend the length over to form a hook. It should now take on the appearance of a candy cane. Repeat to make another one.  Adding the Candy Cane Antlers to a Headband Kink the base of one candy cane to bend it slightly. Bend as little as possible, to avoid wasting the length. Choose a spot for each candy cane to sit on the headband. They are meant to look like antlers, so space them apart enough. Mark with a pencil to remember the exact positioning. Glue the bent portion of the first candy cane to the underside of the headband. Hold in place briefly to ensure it is tethered, then let dry completely. Repeat with the other candy cane.  Pull the candy cane antlers upright. They should sit straight above the headband. Slip the headband on. Once the antlers have completely dried in place, test the look in front of the mirror. Make any adjustments needed to the hook shape, to ensure it looks good. Match the headband with a red or green sweater. Head out and have some holiday season fun. Finished.
